title.narrative: 6. EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE/DRR

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, the country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated and supported to meet quality programming standards in attaining the results in favour of the most marginalized children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF Burkina Faso operationalized its field presence and strengthened its capacity to provide an effective response to the increasing needs of vulnerable children affected by the crisis. Additional technical expertise was brought on board at national and decentralized level. The setting up of the field office in Fada, (Est region) was completed. The capacity of the national office and of the existing field offices in Dori (Sahel) and Kaya (Centre Est) was reinforced and an emergency specialist deployed to Ouahigouya (Nord). UNICEF’s cluster coordination leadership was strengthened at national and sub-national levels in Education, Nutrition, WASH and Child protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2022
